example.eg: I can't drive yet. I'm only 15.
example.egtrans: 我才15岁，我还不能开车。

example.eg: Would you like to drive my new car?
example.egtrans: 你想开我的新车吗？

example.eg: I'll be late to the show unless you can drive me.
example.egtrans: 除非你开车送我，否则我看节目就会迟到了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 驾车运送, 载人, 开车送

example.eg: Wind drives the fan and creates electricity.
example.egtrans: 风驱动风扇，产生电力。

example.eg: Could you drive me to the station?
example.egtrans: 你能开车送我到车站么？

example.eg: The addiction drove him to a life of crime and misery.
example.egtrans: 毒品上瘾驱使他走上犯罪道路，生活凄惨。

example.eg: The desire to make her parents proud is what drives her to succeed.
example.egtrans: 想让父母为自己感到骄傲的心就是驱使她成功的动力。

example.eg: Spending drives the economy.
example.egtrans: 消费推动经济。

example.eg: There's a problem in the drive train.
example.egtrans: 动力传动系统有问题。

example.eg: The drive was really tiring.
example.egtrans: 这一路驾驶过来真的很累。

example.eg: Let's go for a drive in the country.
example.egtrans: 咱们开车去乡下兜兜风吧。

example.eg: His drive to succeed led him into business.
example.egtrans: 他要成功的动力驱使他进入了商界。

dsense.name: drive
dsense.guideword: ([sth] driven: animals, cargo) (指被运送的货物或牲畜)

example.eg: The whole drive of cattle fell ill and nearly died en route.
example.egtrans: 整车的牛全部生病，在路上几乎死光了。

example.eg: He has difficulty controlling his drives.
example.egtrans: 他很难控制自己的欲望。

example.eg: They somehow found the energy for a final drive for the finish line.
example.egtrans: 不知道怎么回事，他们又满血复活，向着终点线进行最后冲刺。

example.eg: The army's drive into enemy territory was a great success.
example.egtrans: 部队攻入敌方领地，这是一大胜利。

example.eg: The spring fund-raising drive was very successful.
example.egtrans: 春节筹款活动大获成功。

example.eg: She's got a lot of drive and that motivates everyone.
example.egtrans: 她干劲十足，大家都深受鼓舞。

example.eg: The belt drive is poorly designed.
example.egtrans: 这个传送带设计得很差。

example.eg: Move the car from neutral to drive and release the brakes.
example.egtrans: 把车从空档挂为驾驶档，然后放开刹车。

example.eg: Her drive sent the ball right past her opponent.
example.egtrans: 她一记抽球， 球从对手身边飞过。

example.eg: Insert the CD into the drive.
example.egtrans: 将CD放入驱动器中。

example.eg: Jane's address is 65 Poplar Drive.
example.egtrans: 简的住址是帕普勒街65号。

example.eg: An expensive-looking sports car turned into the drive.
example.egtrans: 一辆看起来很贵的跑车拐进了那家的私人车道。//萨拉将她的车停在了私人车道上。

example.eg: What drives her to succeed is a desire to make her parents proud.
example.egtrans: 想让父母自豪，这是促使她取得成功的动力。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 促使某人做某事, 驱使某人做某事

example.eg: The yacht drove before the strong wind.
example.egtrans: 风很大，快艇顺风疾驶。

example.eg: The storm drove onwards, gathering strength.
example.egtrans: 风暴向前迅猛推进，一路积蓄着力量。

example.eg: Shall we drive or take the train?
example.egtrans: 我们是开车去还是坐火车去？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 驾车出行, 开车出行

dsense.name: drive
dsense.guideword: (sports: hit or kick) (体育运动术语)

example.eg: In golf, I find driving easier than putting.
example.egtrans: 我发现打高尔夫发球比推球入洞容易。

example.eg: Kane drove a low shot past the goalkeeper.
example.egtrans: 凯恩一记低射，球飞过守门员入网。

example.eg: He drove the runner home with a hit.
They drove the logs down the river.
Ian's desire to be the best is what drives him.
example.egtrans: 伊安想出人头地，这就是他的动力。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 推动, 促进, 驱使

example.eg: Her children always drive her to the point of madness.
example.egtrans: 她家孩子经常把她搞得快疯掉。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…逼到（某种程度）, 逼得

example.eg: She drove the conversation to a certain topic.
example.egtrans: 她把谈话推动到某个话题上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…推动到, 将…推进到

example.eg: He drove the nail into the wall.
She drove the ball into the net.
She wiped a tear from her eye as he drove away.
example.egtrans: 看着他驱车离开，她擦拭了眼角的泪水。

example.eg: Ray drove by in his truck.
The current economic crisis will drive down house prices.
The new legislation was driven forward by fears of mass immigration.
Instead of reversing, he drove forward into a tree.
If we take the train we don't have to drive in and face all that traffic.
You will receive a ticket when you drive into the parking garage.
The drunk driver drove into a wall.
I sadly watched him drive off, knowing I wouldn't see him again.
example.egtrans: 我伤感地看着他驾车离开，知道我们不会再见了。

example.eg: The natives were driven out of their villages by the foreign invaders.
example.egtrans: 当地居民被外来侵略者赶出了自己的村庄。

example.eg: I was surprised to see him drive up in a flashy sportscar.
example.egtrans: 他开了一辆炫酷的跑车前来，让我颇为惊讶。

example.eg: Demand for housing is driving house prices up.
example.egtrans: 对住房的需求正在推动房价上涨。

example.eg: I'll be giving my 95th pint at the blood drive on Monday.
My first motorcycle had a chain drive and I had to remember to check the tension.  The chain drive on a bicycle transfers power from the pedals to turn the wheels.
It is illegal to drink and drive.
I got a good price on my new car because I drove a hard bargain with the salesman.
The shopkeeper drove a hard bargain, but we eventually agreed on a price for the vase.

dsense.name: drive a wedge between [sb], drive a wedge between [sb] and [sb]

example.eg: I can't help feeling that your mother is trying to drive a wedge between us.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在...和...间作梗, 在...和...间挑拨离间

example.eg: What are you driving at?
She drove him away with her constant nagging.
example.egtrans: 他受不了她不停的唠叨，离开了她。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 赶走, 使...远离, 使...离开

example.eg: Osman admitted that he was the gunman in a drive-by.
A man has life-threatening injuries after a drive-by incident in Tucson.
That hip-hop music just drives me crazy!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让人受不了, 快把…烦疯了

example.eg: The way you kiss drives me crazy.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让…为之疯狂, 让…神魂颠倒

example.eg: A sharp blow of the hammer drove the nail home.

dsense.name: drive [sth] home
dsense.guideword: figurative (instil or impress the truth of [sth])

example.eg: My dad's funeral really drove home the fact that he was gone forever.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人意识到, 加深了…的印象

example.eg: When my father met my mother she was a waitress at the drive-in.
example.egtrans: 我父亲遇见我母亲的时候，我母亲还是免下车餐厅的一位服务员。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 免下车餐厅, 得来速
露天的，汽车的，免下车的

example.eg: We had to drive off the wolves that were stalking the sheep.
example.egtrans: 我们必须赶走那些尾随羊群的狼。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 继续开车, 继续驾驶

dsense.name: drive [sb] out of his mind, drive [sb] out of her mind

example.eg: The baby's constant crying drove James out of his mind.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使某人极为恼怒, 气得某人发疯

dsense.name: drive [sb] out of his mind, drive [sb] out of her mind

example.eg: Watching you sunbathe used to drive me out of my mind.
The driver slowly drove over the loose gravel.
You're driving me round the bend!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让...感到无助, 让...绝望

example.eg: I don't think you should drive yourself to the hospital.
The police have arrested an 18-year-old gang member in connection with a drive-by shooting.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 驾车枪击, 驾车枪击案，驾车枪击事件

example.eg: Dave made a quick detour to the drive-through for fries on his way home from the office.
The drive-through restaurant is inaccessible to pedestrians.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 免下车即可获得服务的

dsense.name: flash drive, also UK: pen drive

example.eg: Every paper I wrote this year is on this flash drive.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 半自助的, 空陆联游的

example.eg: The church is holding a food drive this weekend to help needy families.
Drivers in rural areas need a four-wheel drive to cope with winter conditions.

dsense.name: front-wheel drive
dsense.guideword: (car: power to front wheels only) (汽车)

example.eg: Her new car's got front-wheel drive; it's a lot better on slippery roads than her old one was.
Let's go for a drive to the beach with our children.
The police were able to retrieve information from the fraudster's hard drive.
example.egtrans: 警察设法从诈骗犯的硬盘中提取出了信息。

example.eg: The batter hit a liner in the second inning.

dsense.name: self-drive
dsense.guideword: UK (rented vehicle: driven by the renter)

example.eg: After his surgery he had little sex drive.
We used to load reels of tape onto the tape drive so old data could be read.
